Can you identify the word with the same root as "Astronomy" and "Astronomical"? 
Use the formula: 
root word = base word + affix 
To solve this problem, we need to break down the two given words into their base word and affix. 
"Astronomy" can be broken down into "astro" (meaning star) and "-nomy" (meaning the study of). 
"Astronomical" can be broken down into "astro" (meaning star) and "-nomical" (meaning relating to the study of). 
So, the root word of both "Astronomy" and "Astronomical" is "astro". 
Which word contains this root word?

The root word "astro," meaning "star," is found in several words related to celestial bodies or the study of space. One such word that contains this root is "Astrophysics." In "Astrophysics," "astro" refers to stars or celestial bodies, and "physics" pertains to the physical properties and processes associated with them.
